messages.content: <image>You are a visual reasoning expert. How many different digits can you find in this picture? Please ONLY respond with a number.
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Which number do you have to write in the last daisy? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Misty the cat has five kittens: two of them are striped, one spotty, the rest of them are absolutely white. In which picture can we see the kittens of Misty, knowing that the ears of one of them are of different colour? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
D
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. How many bricks are missing in the wall? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The sums of the all the three numbers on each side of the triangle are equal. Two numbers happened to be stained with ink. How much is the sum of these two numbers? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Four people can be seated at a square table. How many people at most could be seated if we pushed four tables of this kind together in one row? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Mike has built a construction, shown in the upper picture, from equal cubes. Lily has taken several cubes out of it, thus Mike's construction became such as we see in the lower picture. How many cubes has Lily taken? Please ONLY respond with a number.
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. How many points are there in the three unseen sides of dice? Please ONLY respond with a number.
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. How many plums (see the picture) weigh as much as an apple? Please ONLY respond with a number.
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Tom bought a chocolate heart (see the picture) to Mary on her birthday. Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The ladybird would like to sit on his flower. The flower has five petals and the stem has three leaves. On which flower should the ladybird sit? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
B

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Theresa moves a pencil along the line. She starts at the arrow shown. In which order will she go past the shapes? Choose one option from the following: ['A: $\\Delta, \\square, \\bullet$', 'B: $\\Delta, \\bullet, \\square$', 'C: $\\bullet, \\Delta, \\square$', 'D: $\\square, \\Delta, \\bullet$', 'E: $\\square, \\bullet, \\Delta$']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. There are more grey squares than white. How many more? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. A big square is made from 25 small squares put together. A few of the small squares have been lost. How many have been lost? Please ONLY respond with a number.
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The kangaroo is inside how many circles? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. When the ant <image1> walks from home <image2> along the arrows $\rightarrow 3, \uparrow 3, \rightarrow 3, \uparrow 1$, he gets to the ladybird <image3>. Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Max has cut a rectangle into two pieces. One piece looks like: Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
E

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Seven sticks lay on top of each other. Stick 2 lays right at the bottom. Stick 6 lays right on top. Which stick lays exactly in the middle? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Each of the digits 2, 3, 4 and 5 will be placed in a square. Then there will be two numbers, which will be added together. What is the biggest number that they could make? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Ingrid has 4 red, 3 blue, 2 green and 1 yellow cube. She uses them to build the following object: Choose one option from the following: ['A: red', 'B: blue', 'C: green', 'D: Yellow', 'E: This cannot be worked out for certain.']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. How many triangles can you find in the picture? Please ONLY respond with a number.
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. How many dots do all ladybirds have together? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Florian has 10 equally long metal strips with equally many holes. Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
B

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Which of the kangaroo cards shown below can be turned around so that it then looks the same as the card shown on the right? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
E

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. What do you see if you look at the tower, which is made up of two building blocks, exactly from above? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Every one of these six building blocks consists of 5 little cubes. The little cubes are either white or grey. Cubes of equal colour don't touch each other. How many little white cubes are there in total? Please ONLY respond with a number.
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Which piece is missing? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Which point in the labyrinth can we get to, starting at point $O$? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
C

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Max has 10 dice. Which one of the following solids can he build with them? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Gerda walks along the road and writes down the letters she can see on her right hand side. Which word is formed while Gerda walks from point 1 to point 2? Choose one option from the following: ['A: KNAO', 'B: KNGO', 'C: KNR', 'D: AGRO', 'E: KAO']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. <image1> Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
E
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. <image1> Please ONLY respond with a number.
C

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Ellen wants to decorate the butterfly Which butterfly can she make? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Into how many pieces will the string be cut? Please ONLY respond with a number.
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. How many blocks are missing in this igloo? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. This picture shows a bracelet with pearls. Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
E
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Four of the numbers 1,3,4,5 and 7 are written into the boxes so that the calculation is correct. Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Jim and Ben are sitting in a ferris wheel (see picture on the right). The ferris wheel is turning. Now Ben is in the position where Jim was beforehand. Where is Jim now? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
C

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Alfred turns his building block 10 times. The first three times can be seen in the picture. Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
D

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Each one of the four keys locks exactly one padlock. Every letter on a padlock stands for exactly one digit. Same letters mean same digits. Choose one option from the following: ['A: GDA', 'B: ADG', 'C: GAD', 'D: GAG', 'E: DAD']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
D
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Peter has drawn this pattern: Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
D

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. In order to get to his bone, the dog has to follow the black line. In total he turns 3-times to the right and 2-times to the left. Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
E

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Lisa needs exactly 3 pieces to complete her jigsaw. Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'C or D']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Charles cuts a rope into 3 equally long pieces. Then he makes one knot in one of the pieces, 2 in the next and in the third piece 3 knots. Then he lays the three pieces down in a random order. Which picture does he see? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
B

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Which of the 5 pictures shows a part of this chain? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
C
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Jörg is sorting his socks. Two socks with the same number are one pair. Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Five equally big square pieces of card are placed on a table on top of each other. The picture on the side is created this way. The cards are collected up from top to bottom. In which order are they collected? Choose one option from the following: ['A: 5-4-3-2-1', 'B: 5-2-3-4-1', 'C: 5-4-2-3-1', 'D: 5-3-2-1-4', 'E: 5-2-3-1-4']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
E

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The floor of a room is covered with equally big rectangular tiles (see picture). How long is the room? <image1> Choose one option from the following: ['A: $6 \\mathrm{~m}$', 'B: $8 \\mathrm{~m}$', 'C: $10 \\mathrm{~m}$', 'D: $11 \\mathrm{~m}$', 'E: $12 \\mathrm{~m}$']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
E

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The picture shows a mouse and a piece of cheese. The mouse is only allowed to move to the neighbouring fields in the direction of the arrows. How many paths are there from the mouse to the cheese? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Which of the figures can be cut into these 3 pieces? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
C

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. There are white, grey and black squares. Three children use these to make this pattern. Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Julia has 5 pieces of plastic and has stacked these pieces on a table, as shown beside. What was the second piece she put on the table? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
C

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Marco's father took a picture of his son in front of the car shown beside. Which of the drawings below could represent this picture? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
E

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Maria made a block using white cubes and colored cubes in equal amounts. How many of the white cubes cannot be seen in the picture? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Ana draws some shapes on a sheet. Her drawing has fewer squares than triangles. What could be her drawing? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
D

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. A village of 12 houses has four straight streets and four circular streets. The map shows 11 houses. In each straight street there are three houses and in each circular street there are also three houses. Where should the 12th house be placed on this map? Choose one option from the following: ['A: On A', 'B: On B', 'C: On C', 'D: On D', 'E: On E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
D

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Six figures were drawn, one on each side of a cube, as shown beside, in different positions. On the side that does not appear beside is this drawing: Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
B

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Two equal trains, each with 31 numbered wagons, travel in opposite directions. When the wagon number 7 of a train is side by side with the wagon number 12 of the other train, which wagon is side by side with the wagon number 11 ? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Six different numbers, chosen from integers 1 to 9 , are written on the faces of a cube, one number per face. The sum of the numbers on each pair of opposite faces is always the same. Which of the following numbers could have been written on the opposite side with the number 8 ? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. In the figure, an arrow pointing from one person to another means that the first person is shorter than the second. For example, person $B$ is shorter than person $A$. Which person is the tallest? Choose one option from the following: ['A: Person A', 'B: Person B', 'C: Person C', 'D: Person D', 'E: Person E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
C

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Maia the bee can only walk on colorful houses. How many ways can you color exactly three white houses with the same color so that Maia can walk from $A$ to $B$ ? Please ONLY respond with a number.
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The picture shows 2 mushrooms. What is the difference between their heights? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Ella puts on this t-shirt and stands in front of a mirror. Which of these images does she see in the mirror? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. These children are standing in a line. Some are facing forwards and others are facing backwards. How many children are holding another child's hand with their right hand? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. In the Kangaroo constellation, all stars have a number greater than 3 and their sum is 20 . Which is the Kangaroo constellation? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
B
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Edmund cut a ribbon as shown in the picture. How many pieces of the ribbon did he finish with? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Which figure can be made from the 2 pieces shown on the right? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The picture shows the five houses of five friends and their school. The school is the largest building in the picture. To go to school, Doris and Ali walk past Leo's house. Eva walks past Chole's house. Which is Eva's house? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
B

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Every time the witch has 3 apples she turns them in to 1 banana. Every time she has 3 bananas she turns them in to 1 apple. What will she finish with if she starts with 4 apples and 5 bananas? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The numbers in the five circles around each house add up to 20 . Some numbers are missing. Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The picture shows 5 cubes from the front. What do they look like from above? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
B

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Susi folds a piece of paper in the middle. She stamps 2 holes. Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
B
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The two markers with a question mark have the same number. Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Each of the children Ali, Lea, Josef, Vittorio and Sophie get a birthday cake. The number on top of the cake shows how old the child is. Lea is two years older than Josef, but one year younger than Ali. Vittorio is the youngest. Which cake belongs to Sophie? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
C

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. According to the rule given in the left picture below, we construct a numerical triangle with an integer number greater than 1 in each cell. Which of the numbers given in the answers cannot appear in the shaded cell? Choose one option from the following: ['A: 154', 'B: 100', 'C: 90', 'D: 88', 'E: 60']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. We first draw an equilateral triangle, then draw the circumcircle of this triangle, then circumscribe a square to this circle. After drawing another circumcircle, we circumscribe a regular pentagon to this circle, and so on. We repeat this construction with new circles and new regular polygons (each with one side more than the preceding one) until we draw a 16 -sided regular polygon. How many disjoint regions are there inside the last polygon? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. In the picture $A B C D$ is a rectangle with $A B=16, B C=12$. Let $E$ be such a point that $A C \perp C E, C E=15$. If $F$ is the point of intersection of segments $A E$ and $C D$, then the area of the triangle $A C F$ is equal to Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. A circle $K$ is inscribed in a quarter circle with radius 6 as shown in the figure. What is the radius of circle $K$? Choose one option from the following: ['A: $\\frac{6-\\sqrt{2}}{2}$', 'B: $\\frac{3 \\sqrt{2}}{2}$', 'C: 2.5', 'D: 3', 'E: $6(\\sqrt{2}-1)$']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
E

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The figure shows graphs of functions $f$ and $g$ defined on real numbers. Each graph consists of two perpendicular halflines. Which equality is satisfied for every real number $x$? Choose one option from the following: ['A: $f(x)=-g(x)+2$', 'B: $f(x)=-g(x)-2$', 'C: $f(x)=-g(x+2)$', 'D: $f(x+2)=-g(x)$', 'E: $f(x+1)=-g(x-1)$']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
C
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. How many triangles can be drawn with vertices in the 18 points shown in the figure? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. A $3 \times 3 \times 3$ cube weighs 810 grams. If we drill three holes through it as shown, each of which is a $1 \times 1 \times 3$ rectangular parallelepiped, the weight of the remaining solid is: Choose one option from the following: ['A: $540 \\mathrm{~g}$', 'B: $570 \\mathrm{~g}$', 'C: $600 \\mathrm{~g}$', 'D: $630 \\mathrm{~g}$', 'E: $660 \\mathrm{~g}$']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
C

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. We are given three semi-circles as shown. $A B E F$ is a rectangle and the radius of each of the semi-circles is $2 \mathrm{~cm}$. $E$ and $F$ are the centers of the bottom semi-circles. The area of the shaded region (in $\mathrm{cm}^{2}$) is: Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. In the quadrilateral $A B C D$ the diagonal $B D$ is the bisector of $\angle A B C$ and $A C=B C$. Given $\angle B D C=80^{\circ}$ and $\angle A C B=20^{\circ}, \angle B A D$ is equal to: Choose one option from the following: ['A: $90^{\\circ}$', 'B: $100^{\\circ}$', 'C: $110^{\\circ}$', 'D: $120^{\\circ}$', 'E: $135^{\\circ}$']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
D

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. In the diagram, $A B$ has length $1 ; \angle A B C=\angle A C D=90^{\circ}$; $\angle C A B=\angle D A C=\theta$. What is the length of $A D$? Choose one option from the following: ['A: $\\cos \\beta+\\tg \\beta$', 'B: $\\frac{1}{\\cos (2 \\beta)}$', 'C: $\\cos ^{2} \\beta$', 'D: $\\cos (2 \\beta)$', 'E: $\\frac{1}{\\cos ^{2} \\beta}$']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
E

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The cells of a $4 \times 4$ table are coloured black and white as shown in the left figure. One move allows us to exchange any two cells positioned in the same row or in the same column. What is the least number of moves necessary to obtain in the right figure? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Points $M$ and $N$ are given on the sides $A B$ and $B C$ of a rectangle $A B C D$. Then the rectangle is divided into several parts as shown in the picture. The areas of 3 parts are also given in the picture. Find the area of the quadrilateral marked with "?". Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. A die is in the position shown in the picture. It can be rolled along the path of 12 squares as shown. How many times must the die go around the path in order for it to return to its initial position with all faces in the initial positions? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Two semicircles are drawn as shown in the figure. The chord $C D$, of length 4 , is parallel to the diameter $A B$ of the greater semicircle and touches the smaller semicircle. Then the area of the shaded region equals Choose one option from the following: ['A: $\\pi$', 'B: $1.5 \\pi$', 'C: $2 \\pi$', 'D: $3 \\pi$', 'E: Not enough data']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
C
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. We see in the diagram at the right a piece of the graphic of the function Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. A river starts at point $A$. As it flows the river splits into two. The first branch takes $\frac{2}{3}$ of the water and the second takes the rest. Later the first branch splits into three, one taking $\frac{1}{8}$ of the branch's water, the second $\frac{5}{8}$ and the third one the rest. Further down this last branch meets again a branch of the river. The map below shows the situation. What part of the original water flows at point $B$? Choose one option from the following: ['A: $\\frac{1}{3}$', 'B: $\\frac{5}{4}$', 'C: $\\frac{2}{9}$', 'D: $\\frac{1}{2}$', 'E: $\\frac{1}{4}$']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
D
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. We take three points from the grid so that they were collinear. How many possibilities do we have? Please ONLY respond with a number.
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. In the figure each asterisk stands for one digit. The sum of the digits of the product is equal to Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The square $A B C D$ has a side of length 1 and $M$ is the midpoint of $A B$. The area of the shaded region is Choose one option from the following: ['A: $\\frac{1}{24}$', 'B: $\\frac{1}{16}$', 'C: $\\frac{1}{8}$', 'D: $\\frac{1}{12}$', 'E: $\\frac{2}{13}$']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
D
<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. We used metal rods to build this nice ensemble. We know there are 61 octagons. How many rods are there? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The suare in the diagram has side length 1. The radius of the small circle would Choose one option from the following: ['A: $\\sqrt{2}-1$', 'B: $\\frac{1}{4}$', 'C: $\\frac{\\sqrt{2}}{4}$', 'D: $1-\\frac{\\sqrt{2}}{2}$', 'E: $(\\sqrt{2}-1)^{2}$']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
E

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Each side of a triangle $A B C$ is being extended to the points $\mathrm{P}, \mathrm{Q}, \mathrm{R}, \mathrm{S}, \mathrm{T}$ and $\mathrm{U}$, so that $\mathrm{PA}=\mathrm{AB}=\mathrm{BS}, \mathrm{TC}=\mathrm{CA}$ $=\mathrm{AQ}$ and $\mathrm{UC}=\mathrm{CB}=\mathrm{BR}$. The area of $\mathrm{ABC}$ is 1. How big is the area of the hexagon PQRSTU? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. In the diagram on the right we want to colour the fields with the colours A, B, C and D so that adjacent fields are always in different colours. (Even fields that share only one corner, count as adjacent.) Some fields have already been coloured in. In which colour can the grey field be coloured in? Choose one option from the following: ['A: either A or B', 'B: only C', 'C: only D', 'D: either C or D', 'E: A, B, C or D']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
D

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. A (very small) ball is kicked off from point A on a square billiard table with side length $2 \mathrm{~m}$. After moving along the shown path and touching the sides three times as indicated, the path ends in point $B$. How long is the path that the bal travels from A to B? (As indicated on the right: incident angle = emergent angle.) Choose one option from the following: ['A: 7', 'B: $2 \\sqrt{13}$', 'C: 8', 'D: $4 \\sqrt{3}$', 'E: $2 \\cdot(\\sqrt{2}+\\sqrt{3})$']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
B

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. In the diagram to the right a $2 \times 2 \times 2$ cube is made up of four transparent $1 \times 1 \times 1$ cubes and four non-transparent black $1 \times 1 \times 1$ cubes. They are placed in a way so that the entire big cube is nontransparent; i.e. looking at it from the front to the back, the right to the left, the top to the bottom, at no point you can look through the cube. What is the minimum number of black $1 \times 1 \times 1$ cubes needed to make a $3 \times 3 \times 3$ cube non-transparent in the same way? Please ONLY respond with a number.

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. In the diagram on the right we see the birdô-eye view and front elevation of a solid that is defined by flat surfaces (i.e. view from obove and the front respectively). Bird' s-Eye View (view from above): <image1>. Front Elevation (view from the front): <image2>. Choose one option from the following: ['A: I', 'B: II', 'C: III', 'D: IV', 'E: none of them']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
D

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. The sum of the number in each line, column and diagonal in the Ămagic squareñon the right is always constant. Only two numbers are visible. Which number is missing in field $a$? Choose one option from the following: ['A: 16', 'B: 51', 'C: 54', 'D: 55', 'E: 110']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
D

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. In a rectangle JKLM the angle bisector in $\mathrm{J}$ intersects the diagonal KM in $\mathrm{N}$. The distance of $\mathrm{N}$ to $\mathrm{LM}$ is 1 and the distance of $\mathrm{N}$ to $\mathrm{KL}$ is 8. How long is LM? Choose one option from the following: ['A: $8+2 \\sqrt{2}$', 'B: $11-\\sqrt{2}$', 'C: 10', 'D: $8+3 \\sqrt{2}$', 'E: $11+\\frac{\\sqrt{2}}{2}$']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. Which of the following graphs represents the solution set of $(x-|x|)^{2}+(y-|y|)^{2}=4$? Choose one option from the following: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
A

<image>You are a visual reasoning expert. A strip of paper is folded three times as shown. Determine $\beta$ if $\alpha=70^{\circ}$. Choose one option from the following: ['A: $140^{\\circ}$', 'B: $130^{\\circ}$', 'C: $120^{\\circ}$', 'D: $110^{\\circ}$', 'E: $100^{\\circ}$']. Please ONLY respond with the selected option letter.
C
